intro: Arum vulgare, commonly known as the common arum, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It features a distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a showy, petal-like spathe. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often dark green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The plant is part of the Araceae family, which includes other familiar genera such as Caladium and Dieffenbachia.
